body.name: Sceptre IPS 24” Gaming Monitor 165Hz 144Hz Full HD (1920 x 1080) FreeSync Eye Care FPS RTS DisplayPort HDMI Build-in Speakers, Machine Black 2020 (E248B-FPT168),IPS 24" 165Hz
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 6 hrs 11 mins
features: up to 165Hz Refresh Rate: Pushing beyond the standard 144Hz, 165Hz gives gamers an edge in visibility as frames transition instantly, leaving behind no blurred images.
IPS Panel: The IPS (In-Plane Switching) panel cannot be beat when it comes to consistently delivering top color performance and sharp visibility from multiple viewing angles.

AMD FreeSync: With FreeSync, gamers now enjoy smooth video and seamless on the spot movement through their fast paced games. FreeSync is an AMD technology that nearly eliminates tearing and stuttering due to differences between a graphics card's frame rate and a monitor's refresh rate.
Edgeless Design: Edgeless Design completely immerses you in all the captivating action and wondrous scenery that 1080P resolution and 165Hz refresh rate have to offer.
Multiple Digital Ports: While three HDMI ports each deliver an impressive 144Hz refresh rate, one DisplayPort produces a stunning 165Hz refresh rate, all in FHD resolution.

Blue Light Shift: Reduce your monitors blue light to protect you from eye fatigue, irritation and strains. This enables you to work on your documents, watch movies, or play games more comfortably for extended periods.
Built-in Speakers: With built-in speakers, the monitor delivers office level audio for conference calls and internet workshops. Similarly, enjoy engaging audio while listening to your favorite tunes.
Anti-Flicker: Provides a crisper picture by preventing the backlight from flickering periodically.
body.description: 24" LED Monitor 1920 x 1080 FHD Resolution IPS Panel Up to 165Hz Refresh Rate 1ms Response Time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's actually an excellent monitor.
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this for a few days now, overall it's a great product (especially on sale at $120). I'm glad I took the chance on a brand I've never heard of. Rumor has it that this monitor is using the same panel as some $200 monitor sold by ASUS, which is what really sold me on trying an unknown brand.This is replacing an older 60Hz TN monitor for me, and I've only used TN panels (It's been a long time since I bought a monitor). So maybe take this with a grain of salt. I've also been using the monitor defaults for testing it out.Pros:No frills or gimmicks. Just a monitor that displays an image.On the back every video input is clearly labeled like in the image, and says exactly what version of HDMI each port supports. Instead of guessing, or looking up the manual.Bezel is almost non-existent.Stand is made out of metal, just a nice touch.Color quality is excellent out of the box, I haven't even bothered calibrating colors yet. Blacks are actually black. Whites are blinding, but white. Blue really pops, Red and Green seem good but don't pop as much as blue. The color quality between the TN panels and IPS is night and day better.General image quality is crisp and clear. Text looks crisp, I'm noticing minor details in shadows from movies and games I couldn't see before. The DPI on this monitor seems much higher than my previous TN. Or its just the difference between how TN and IPS pixels are made?Image quality in motion is excellent. By default the Overdrive setting is set to "Medium" and it has some very minor ghosting visible in the Blur Busters test, but I haven't noticed any ghosting at all while playing any games, even FPS games. I have no idea what the response time is when overdrive is set to medium, but it seems low enough to not think about. I actually forgot I hadn't changed it until typing this.165Hz over Display Port is a nice bonus. Adaptive Sync works as expected, even on an Intel GPU. On Intel Arc the "Variable Refresh Rate Range" supports 48Hz - 165Hz. Though IIRC FreeSync is supposed to support as low as 30Hz. This may just be an Intel support issue.Cons:The monitor is scary thin. The top half of the monitor is basically just a plastic cover for the back of the panel. There is no structure holding the top half of the panel. I'm worried I'm going to bend the panel when adjusting the tilt. On one hand it's really impressive how thin this monitor is, on the other hand it just feels very fragile. Bending your screen while adjusting the tilt would have to be the most stupid way of breaking your monitor of all time. If it falls over somehow, it's 100% going to damage the panel. There's just no structure protecting the panel IMO. Perhaps on the next version Sceptre should add a little structural rigidity for peace of mind.Stand is comically short. Though it is quite wide so it isn't tipping over easily.PS Shout out to the seller, who shipped immediately. The package arrived like 5 days early. I had to sign for it, so FedEx didn't just leave my brand new monitor on the porch. Which I appreciate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised with this monitor. The edgeless design works well and helps save small amounts of desk space (works great with cubicle style desks with need for smaller monitors on monitor arms). Took some getting used to the “eye care” feature that seems more like a privacy screen. Make sure the monitor is at a good level and centered for best visuals. Small annoyance that it only gets 165hz through display port but other than that it’s a perfect monitor for me.Also the built in speakers are literally useless, otherwise this gets 5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my husband who games & he loves it. It’s great quality for the price. The speakers aren’t great, but if you plan to use a gaming headset that shouldn’t matter. Once you figure out your picture settings preferences you’re good to go. Great for the money, probably just as good as a more expensive monitor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good bright picture. No problems after months of usage. Wish it had a swivel.
reviews.reviewText: The screen itself is great for the price class, especially for 1080p gaming. The only problem is the mount doesn't have any way to adjust it's height or tilt. I've resorted to using cardboard to prop up on end to get the viewing angle I desire. If not for the lack of physical adjustability, I'd consider this a great buy for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Monitor. Even more amazing customer service.
reviews.reviewText: So, I'm going to address the elephant in the room first. I purchased this monitor in August of 2020. It did work great for 90% of the year that I owned it. It reaches 165hz natively without needing to do any kind of overclocking or the like. It has a nice response time in games and is a decent size without being overly large in the event you want a multi-monitor setup. It more than fits the bill for its price point.However, I said it worked great for 90% of the year. This is because the monitor developed some white spots that obscured vision and were very unpleasing to look at around June of 2021. The reason as to why this review still has 5 stars is because of the absolutely amazing customer service Sceptre provided me. I contacted the TA email, and they asked me for the standard stuff: make and model, what the model # was, etc. Then, they told me to make an RMA request to get it fixed. This was done for free, even without having any kind of warranty or insurance. Furthermore, they even provided me with packaging to safely ship the monitor with, and a new adapter/stand upon its return after being fixed free of charge.All I had to pay was for the shipping of the package itself. So while I did have a minor cosmetic issue, (some white spots showing up on the monitor), the amazing customer service and overall reliability of the monitor otherwise let me confidently write out a 5-star review. You're a great company Sceptre, and I'll make sure to keep you guys in mind for future tech purchases.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's smooth and has beautiful colors
reviews.reviewText: This is the perfect monitor. It goes 144 Hertz using a regular HDMI. It is buttery smooth. There is no ghosting whatsoever. It is absolutely perfect. the blacks are really accurate all the colors pop and are very vibrant. It has a lot of options to change the colors such as. Saturation and contrast overall a fantastic monitor.P.S if you are someone who has a 75 Hertz. Monitor and have a PC and are wondering if it's worth the upgrade. I 100% say it's worth the upgrade. I thought the 75 Hertz would be all that I would need but it makes a world of difference. having a 144 Hertz monitor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The resolution is very good
reviews.reviewText: Excelent monitor for my lenovo legion

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Monitor for Gaming on a Budget
reviews.reviewText: The monitor works great with a lot of games and the graphics are also above my expectations. The speakers are probably the only thing I’d say need an upgrade but they are in the monitor so there not much room for that a good set of plug in speakers fixes that issue. All in all a great monitor and great deal.

So far, very pleased. I've seen this recommended by some Tech-tubers as an entry level gaming monitor, and picked it up on sale during Black Friday. Great upgrade for my son, and he seems very pleased. Nice colors, brightness, etc, given the bargain level price. Seems to support AMD Freesync too, which is nice to have.

reviews.reviewTitle: Para aquellos que no quieren o no tienen Display Port
reviews.reviewText: La versión qué compre es de 165 hz a través de display port y 144 hz a través de hdmi, sin embargo esto no es del todo cierto, a través del puerto hdmi conseguí fácilmente 165 hz desde mi laptop (en la imagen que adjunte pueden comprobar qué la entrada es hdmi a 165hz), la grafica es una gtx 2060, utilice un cable común y corriente, incluso lo probé con el cable qué incluye la nintendo switch y sin ningún problema logra los 165 hz, hice algunas pruebas para asegurarme de que esto era correcto, efectivamente puedes notar la diferencia entre 165 y 144 por lo que puedo asegurar que la entrada hdmi del monitor soporta 165 hz a pesar de estar marcado como 144 en las especificaciones, por lo que si tu laptop no cuenta con salida display port no tienes de que preocuparte, siempre y cuando tu pc sea capaz de manejar los 165 hz. He escuchado que en algunas laptops con gráficos integrados, o incluso algunas con tarjeta de video dedicada no logran llegar a los 144 o 165, sin embargo si tu pc es relativamente moderna y cuenta con tarjeta de video dedicada muy probablemente no tengas problema. El monitor es excelente, muy buenos angulos de visión, buena calidad, sin ghosting en lo absoluto gracias al overdrive, no existe latencia en lo absoluto (cosa que he experimentado en otros monitores al conectar mi laptop a ellos), es un 9 de 10, para darle el 10 solo mejoraría las bocinas, a pesar de ello las bocinas se escuchan alto y el sonido es totalmente claro, pero hay una ausencia total de graves.
Après 2 ans il marche parfaitement bien parcontre après 2 ans le DisplayPort m’a lâcher

Lo que está en la descripción es lo que recibimos, nos encanta la claridad de la imagen. Si tiene bocinas incluidas pero igual si valdría la pena comprar bocinas por separado ya que el audio no es el mejor. Estamos muy satisfechos con la compra

PROS-Picture quality is GREATBuild quality is GREAT3 hdmi slots and 1 dviGood positioning for the plugsVery tiny bezelVery low price for a ips monitorStand doesn't take up alot of desk spaceGreat for dual monitor setups.Cons-None that I can think of yet.
